comments:
Build 20020205 using Team 2.0

Somehow our org.eclipse.ui.tests plugin got a PDE nature stored on it in the 
repository.
I loaded it with the Team 2.0 support into a new workspace (along with 
org.eclipse.ui, which does not have the PDE nature).

I got the following errors, and the PDE plugin was disabled.

Here is the contents of the .vcm_meta

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<project-description>
	<nature id="org.eclipse.jdt.core.javanature"/>
	<nature id="org.eclipse.pde.PluginNature"/>
	<reference project-name="org.eclipse.core.resources"/>
	<reference project-name="org.eclipse.core.runtime"/>
	<reference project-name="org.eclipse.swt"/>
	<reference project-name="org.eclipse.ui"/>
	<reference project-name="org.junit"/>
	<builder name="org.eclipse.jdt.core.javabuilder">
	</builder>
	<builder name="org.eclipse.pde.ManifestBuilder">
	</builder>
	<builder name="org.eclipse.pde.SchemaBuilder">
	</builder>
</project-description>

I am removing the PDE nature from this plugin, so you will need to create your 
own test case.

PDE has been separated into PDE Core and PDE UI. No PDE UI code will be loaded 
as a result of a build due to this separation.

traces.message: Problems encountered starting up plug- in: org.eclipse.pde.
Problems encountered while setting  project description.
Problems encountered starting up plug- in: org.eclipse.pde.
